item.title: The Centre for Excellence in Taxation has been launched by Singapore Management University
item.description: Singapore Management University (SMU) has partnered with the Tax Academy of Singapore and the Inland Revenue Authority of Singapore to establish the SMU-TA Centre for Excellence in Taxation (SMU-TA CET). This groundbreaking research center is the first of its kind in Singapore. The SMU-TA CET signifies a substantial step towards investigating international and regional tax matters and policies. Its primary goal is to generate comprehensive research in these areas to inform policy development.

item.title: Tourists are disappointed with shopping in Singapore, while locals are loyal to their telecommunications companies
item.description: A study by the Institute of Service Excellence (ISES) at Singapore Management University reveals a drop in customer satisfaction within Singapore’s retail and info-communications sectors. The 2014 Q1 Customer Satisfaction Index of Singapore (CSISG) indicates a 2.5 point (3.5%) decrease to 69.6 points for retail and a 0.9 point (1.3%) decrease to 66.8 points for info-communications, both compared to the previous year. item.title: Many Singaporeans are aware of human trafficking but underestimate its prevalence
item.description: The International Organization for Migrationâ€™s X Campaign (IOM X), in collaboration with USAID, the US Embassy in Singapore, and Microsoft, recently released findings from their pilot outreach program, IOM X Connect Singapore. This initiative sought to increase awareness about human trafficking in Singapore. During the project, students from the National University of Singapore (NUS) and Singapore Management University (SMU) utilized the newly developed IOM X Learn, Act and Share App. They tested the knowledge of 100 Singaporean residents on the topic of human trafficking.
